description: Our Public National Health System is under threat like never before. Since its introduction in the face of widespread opposition from healthcare professionals, the Health and Social Care Act has allowed private companies to win around 70% of tendered healthy contracts worth billions of pounds. Corporate giants such as Serco, Virgin Care and McKinsey stand to make huge profits from the changes. Struggling to recover from a winter of struggle and beset by problems, the NHS is now the top priority for the electorate ahead of the May elections. Leading doctor, author and expert Allyson Pollock travels to Cambridge to show why the marketisation prescribed to cure the NHS is having such disastrous side effects. Rupert Read of the Cambridge Green Party will set out arguments for a fully public health system. With guest speakers including Keep Our NHS Public, the evening promises to enthuse and inspire the fightback for our cherished NHS. Friends Meeting House, 12 Jesus Lane, Cambridge CB5 8BA 3-4 speakers, short film, presentation, discussion and workshopAttendance is free of charge - all welcome
title: NHS: Not For Sale - Dr. Allyson Pollock public meeting

location_text: The corner of Mill Street and Castle Street, Macclesfield
description: A Vigil and leaflet distribution calling for urgent action to tackle economic inequality.  The gap between rich and poor in the U.K. is bigger now than at any time since World War One.  Studies show that health and social problems, including infant mortality, mental health difficulties, and violent crime, are greater in more UNequal societies.Let's ask the politicians of all parties to close the gap, by getting them ensure the minimum wage is enough to live on; ensure that taxes are fair; ensure people on low incomes are't forced to pay over the odds for basics like food and fuel.Poster, leaflets. T-shirts provided.  Those holding placards to stand in silent vigil for one hour (or however long you can spare), those leafleting will engage with the public.
title: Vigil & Leafleting during "Quaker Equality Week"

description: We aim to catch the train from Dewsbury station to connect with Calderdale 38degrees NHS Campaign supporters, at Leeds station at 11 o'clock. We will assemble at Dewsbury Station from 10.30am, to catch the 10:41 train to Leeds, with some supporters boarding at Batley station at 10:44. This train gets into Leeds at 11:02 where we will join the Calderdale supporters and walk up at 11:15, to the assembly point outside the Art Gallery on the Headrow, arriving at the main march assembly time of 11:30. The full price fare on the train for a return ticket is about £5. A senior citizens bus pass will reduce the cost on the train, or alternatively travel to Leeds on the bus and meet at the assembly point outside the Art Gallery for 11:30. Please wear 38degrees T shirts, and badges etc. Make a placard, (not too heavy!) You can just walk a short way at the beginning or all the way, depending how you feel. The end time stated is approximate. Bring friends and family. Leave when you are ready. I do not know if any Candidates are attending. The Leeds March round the city is being organised by Leeds Keep Our NHS Public.Date & Time Saturday, 28 March 2015 from 10:30 AM to 3:30 PM

description: Dewsbury 38degrees is organising a feeder walk to meet up with Calderdale 38degrees at Leeds Railway station. We will all then walk up to the assembly point together.  The train we are catching will get in to Batley station at 10:44am. You can join us to travel to the meeting point at Leeds station, alternatively you can catch a bus, or other transport and meet outside the Art Gallery on The Headrow, Leeds, for 11:30am. Return fares for the train are about £5 although showing a bus pass will reduce that sum. Please wear 38degrees badges T-shirts and possibly make a light easy to carry banner. Walk a short distance or as far as you like. Leave when you are ready. I do not know if any of the candidates will attend this walk. You can see the Dewsbury plan, by clicking on the 'nearby events' button, at the top right hand side of the page.

location_text: Opposite The Point nightclub in Sunderland
description: Spending a couple of hours collecting signatures and gathering public support to help save our NHS.

We're making Saturday March 28th a big day for NHS supporters in our region. In York, we'll be assembling at 9.30am in King's Square and marching across the city centre to Leeman Road Memorial Gardens. Following on, those who can will be taking a coach to Leeds to join a much bigger march with people from across Yorkshire. Book your coach seat today for a £5 deposit - https://www.eventbrite.co.uk/e/york-to-leeds-for-the-nhs-tickets-16017887934 Thanks to support from UNITE the Union, we're able to refund the £5 coach ticket to people on the day (unfortunately we can't refund the 95p booking fee). But that means we need to fill it! The coach will leave at 10.15am, once the march has arrived, and will feed us straight into the Leeds march. The Leeds march assembles at the Art Gallery at 11.30 with a view to setting off by 12.15. We will return to Victoria Gardens outside the Art Gallery for a short rally and wrap up around 2 p.m. However if there are thousands of us, it could take a while longer!  The weekend of the 28th March is the  third anniversary of the passing of the Health and Social Care Act , which flung the doors of the NHS wide open to privatization. It is also earmarked as a KONP national day of action and is a good time to send a clear message to all parties in the run up to the elections that we will not stand by and let them wreck our NHS through privatization and starving it of funds. The PCS (et al) Samba band are coming over from Manchester to lead  the march and we welcome other musicians,  performers, costumes and  props to lend a festive atmosphere to the  march as well as banners and placards.  ( individual “home made “ones always stand out! )
title: Feeder March to Join Leeds March

If you oppose plans to privatise NHS departments at the Royal Cornwall Hospital Trust (and elsewhere), come and make your voice heard!  We call on everyone who cares about keeping the NHS whole to join us! Please share this event as widely as possible and use the discussion board to make plans with others who are planning to attend. **Please RSVP if you plan to join (click the button below) so we can keep you updated with plans / timings as they develop. **Share event details with others using by cutting and pasting this link http://election.38degrees.org.uk/events/1153  * We advise people to use the park & ride service at Threemilestone to get to Treliske (leave plenty of time)* The Trust Board meeting starts at 10am so we encourage demonstrators to be in position early, outside the entrance to the Knowledge Spa, by 9.30am.* Bring homemade banners / placards to show Trust Board members how you feel about NHS privatisation* There will be a hand-in of the 38 Degrees 'Stop the Royal Cornwall Hospital Sell-Off' petition. set up by a local member in Truro. We'll head back to the pub for a debrief after the hustings too!**   From the event organisers: At the meeting, each of the five candidates will have a few minutes to make a short pitch, and then they will be able to answer questions.  The Church is fully accessible for those with limited mobility; there is a hearing loop; and some on-street parking is available.  The meeting will finish not later than 10.00 pm. Whether or not you are able to come to the meeting, it would be really helpful if you could submit your questions in advance, to ensure that we can have a balanced, constructive evening.  Please send your questions – preferably before Easter Sunday – by email to: cmynors@gmail.com.

Please join us to collect signatures for its petition to SAVE OUR NHS CAMPAIGN.
title: L'Boro & Charnwood 38 Degrees Group Petition: Save the NHS

location_text: Brighthelm Cafe, North Road, Brighton, BN1 1YD
description: Our first NHS day of action was a huge success so local 38 Degrees members are organising more ‘Save Our NHS’ petition-gathering days in the run up to the election. Together, we're reminding people that our NHS is a precious, life-saving service - and asking them to join us in saying no to cuts and privatisation.  Do you have an hour to spare Saturday 25th April to join in?  All you need to bring along on the day are some printed petition sheets and a clipboard to lean on. You’ll find petition sheets to print, more materials and answers to some common questions at http://blog.38degrees.org.uk/2015/02/05/nhs-day-of-action-faqs/  I love NHS T-shirts!  86% of 38 Degrees members who took part in the first NHS day of action in February said having T-shirts to wear to stand out on the street would have been really useful. So the office team have invested in some bright “I love NHS” T-shirts! Use this link to order yours: https://secure.38degrees.org.uk/page/s/get-your-i-love-nhs-tshirt

location_text: Ryemarket open concourse, off High Street, Stourbridge, DY8 1HJ
description: This is the latest in a series of NHS Day of Action petition-building events in Stourbridge. We’re going for an earlier-than-usual start of 10am to catch the Easter crowds but that doesn’t mean that everyone has to turn up on the stroke of ten. In fact, it’s probably best if we have informal overlapping time shifts of volunteers so that we can share the job out and keep the event going for as long as we can, maybe through to 1.30pm or later. Let us know what would be best for you, if you can be there - email silenced.stourbridge (at) yahoo.co.uk to make special arrangements.  As well as the 38 Degrees-powered petition gathering, we will also highlight the NHS Reinstatement Bill 2015 (www.nhsbill2015.org) that has been tabled for the next Parliament to debate. We've got campaign material on the way. If you have any 38 Degrees NHS petition leaflets left over from last time, please bring them along. Location  We will have our ‘pop-up’ information table and petition point by the Dorothy Perkins side window on the Ryemarket open concourse off the High Street. Dress Code (Optional!)  If you want to wear your heart on your sleeve (or over your heart, actually!) 38 Degrees have got special ‘I Love NHS’ tee-shirts available on their website in exchange for a donation towards costs. (https://secure.38degrees.org.uk/page/s/get-your-i-love-nhs-tshirt#petition) There are many other concerns surrounding aspects of the NHS that are being expressed locally by supporters, particularly mental health provision, maternity services, shrinking GP treatment options and much more.
title: NHS Day of Action with 38 Degrees Stourbridge

description: 16th April is the date of the next leader's debate - a debate between five opposition party leaders on the BBC, moderated by David Dimbleby. All are welcome to join from 7pm, the debate will run 8pm - 9:30pm.  38 Degrees members from across the 3 Ealing constituencies will be gathering to watch this debate in the function room at Drayton Court Hotel. Snacks will be provided and the bar will be open for people to purchase drinks. In addition to swapping analysis of the debate, this will be an opportunity to meet up with other members, discuss the campaigning we've done to date and plan our next steps!  SUBMIT A QUESTIONEmail the question you would like to ask to electiondebate2015@bbc.co.uk or tweet it using the hashtag #BBCdebate. Alternatively, you can text your question to 61124 or message the BBC on WhatsApp +44 7525 900971. Make sure you include your name, location and contact number so a BBC producer can contact you if your question is selected.
title: Leader's Debate Night

description: Come and join us for the big national 'Save our NHS' Day of Action just before the election. We want to make this a powerful and impactful event. The exact plan is still being finalised, but here are the bare bones of it...  During the morning (11am - 2pm) 38 Degrees members will hold stall to* collected petition signatures and * messages of support and thanks for the wonderful NHS workers on a giant (5 feet tall) thank you card  In the afternoon, we'll travel to a local hospital together and hand in the card.  We'll invite all the local candidates to also come at this time and collect a certificate documenting how many thousand people have signed the petition.  If you would like to be involved in helping to plan the stall, card or the petition hand in I'd would love to hear from you! Please email cara.b@38degrees.org.uk
title: Save our NHS National Day of Action

location_text: Chelsea Community Theatre, 7 World's End Place (off King's Road), SW10 0DR
description: The 38 Degrees Chelsea and Fulham group have arranged an info evening on the NHS with speaker Dr Youssef El-Gingihy. Join us! All welcome to this free event. Youssef is an NHS doctor at Bromley-by-Bow Medical Centre. He will discuss in his own words his book, How to Dismantle the NHS in Ten Easy Steps, about the 25 year story of how the NHS has been dismantled and converted into a market based healthcare system, and how the Health & Social Care Act enables the final step to universal insurance coverage (a.k.a. total privatisation). In the run up to the election, the issue of what has happened to the NHS is tangled in contradiction and propaganda. Youssef will help us understand the frightening truth of what's really been happening. Meet at 6.30pm for a 7pm start. Presentation approx. 1 hour. There will be time afterwards for Q&A;, networking and discussion (ends 9pm). Refreshments available to purchase from theatre cafe. Donations gratefully received towards room hire costs.
title: Speaker Dr Youssef El-Gingihy on NHS privatisation

description: Right now, there’s a deal called the Transatlantic Trade and Investment Partnership - TTIP for short - being worked out in secret between the US and EU. It could bring further privatisation of the NHS and allow big corporations to take our government to court - in secret.  Join us in Penzance on Sat 18 April to help hand-out leaflets and raise public awareness of TTIP and its implications.  For more information cut and paste this link into your browser: https://secure.38degrees.org.uk/pages/ttip_more_information

location_text: The Buttercross Pentice, Hight street, Winchester
description: Today is our last National 38 Degrees NHS Day of Action which to be an ideal time to be handing over our Box of Petition signatures to all of our local MP Candidates.The Buttercross Pentice in the High Street seems to be a good place we can group for half-an-hour or so as we hand over our box of petition signatures.Ducan Geddes from Hampshire Chronicle we are meeting before the Day who has agreed to cover the NHS Day of Action & Delivery of Signatures.All our 38 Degrees members who are collecting signatures on the day (25/04) can show their piles of petition sheets straight to the MP candidates! (Before we can upload the remaining signatures online).Being a Saturday there will be a lot of passers-by as before (28/02) who might want to join in too. This is our time to Demand our Candidates to commit to Keeping the NHS Free for All and to Stop any Sell off or Privatisation of the NHS for Profit!We Look forward to the Day. Solidarity.* Saving Our NHS*  No to Cuts, No To Privatisation, No To Sell off to US Trade OFF TTIP & ISDS* Make sure it has the funding it needs to provide High Quality Health Care* Put a STOP to the Privatisation of the NHS* Protect it from US Health Corporations, this power would be increased by ISDS, mechanism of TTIP* Patients NOT Customers, Public Service NOT Private Profit!
title: NHS Petiton Delivery

location_text: Northern Lights Suite, The Pavilion, Whitby
description: Election 2015 – Whitby Hustings On Thursday May 7th we go to the polls to elect our next government and MP.It’s your chance to vote for who you want to represent you in Parliament.The Whitby Pavilion is holding an election debate with our Prospective Parliamentary Candidates on Saturday 18th April from 1.00 pm in the Northern Lights suite; it’s your chance to hear from the candidates asking for your votes in the Scarborough and Whitby constituency.We want you to get involved.Any prospective Councillors representing the Whitby area and wanting to be introduced are also welcomeWe are also interested to hear from any Community Groups who would like to promote their group, as we wish to make this a real Whitby Community eventIf you want to submit a question to be asked of the candidates, please email your question to Joy124Stan@gmail.com or phone 07733615650We want you, the people of Whitby and District, to come along and be involved. The Whitby Pavilion will be open for lunch and drinks, so come and meet your community and our prospective leaders.
title: Whitby Hustings

description: THE PEOPLE'S QUESTION TIME - CARDIFFThursday 23 April, 6.30 pm (Doors open). 7pm Prompt Start.SKLP Samaj Cardiff (Hindu Centre) 6 Mardy Street, Grangetown, Cardiff, CF11 6QTBook your ticket here early to avoid disappointment -http://www.eventbrite.co.uk/e/the-peoples-question-time-cardiff-tickets-16073996757Our precious NHS - saving it! Social housing - developing it! Money for war - diverting it! Tax avoidance - ending it! There ARE alternatives to austerity, Cardiff People's Assembly exists to encourage grassroots action to make those dreams a reality. Join us! Our Panel includes - OWEN JONESCampaigning Journalist & AuthorLINDSEY GERMANPeople's Assembly & Stop the War Coalition SHAVANAH TAJWales Secretary, Public and Commercial Services UnionGWENNO DAFYDDWriter, Broadcaster, Performer, Welsh Language CampaignerSUE LEADEREly Community ActivistMOHAMAD FEZ MIAHLecturer, Youth Worker, Film-maker Men. Women. Older. Younger. People. Side by side. We are in this. Together. If change feels like a distant dream, remember: power is - and has always been - with us. We are the ones we’ve been waiting for. At a time when poverty and inequality continue to rise, and all major parties remain committed to cuts and privatisation, join us at the People's Question Time where we will be discussing how we organise for a fair, sustainable and more secure future - an economy that works for us! Do you have a QUESTION for the panel?  Submit one when you register for a chance to put it at the event. There will also be contributions at the beginning of the event from local groups, letting you know about the great work they are doing fighting for the rights of the people in the face of austerity including BECKY HARFORD from Community Action for Rumney Library & LEE DIRKZWAGER from Grandparents Raising Grandchildren, kinship carers campaign.Note: Ticket prices are solely to cover costs of putting on this event. For any further information contact cardiffpeoplesassembly@gmail.com “What sort of society do we want to be? It is a choice. Do we want to be a society that is fractured, divided, disconnected, mistrustful of its own people – that sees people as commodities, instruments of profit? Or do we want to be a society where each person is recognised, where all are equal in value, and that value is not purely a monetary one? A society that is supportive, inclusive and compassionate” - Michael Sheen, The People's March for the NHS, Tredegar
title: The People's Question Time

Guests are asked to bring their own food and drink or food and drink to share. Party-goers are invited to bring acoustic instruments, warm clothes and lanterns or torches.

description: As part of the global day of action on TTIP, people from across London are coming together for an exciting event 'Democracy vs TTIP’. The event will run from 12midday - 4pm and will feature an open, participatory assembly on TTIP, followed by a series of creative actions to highlight the threat TTIP poses to our NHS, food and environmental protection. We will use the day to reach out widely to the public, bringing to light an issue that is so crucial to us all but invisible to so many. Speakers at the assembly will include John Hilary (Executive Director, War on Want), Jenny Jones (Green Party), Guy Taylor (Trade Campaigner, Global Justice Now), Gay Lee (Keep Our NHS Public), Blanche Jones (38 Degrees) and Sam Lowe (Friends of the Earth). You'll be able to meet up with fellow 38 Degrees members by looking for people in the bright orange t-shirts. It will be an exciting day. Join us!  Democracy vs TTIP is supported by Global Justice Now, War on Want, Friends of the Earth,  the local 38 Degrees group in Hammersmith, Brick Lane Debates, This Changes Everything, Keep Our NHS Public & Students Against TTIP.
title: London wide event: Democracy vs TTIP

description: Join members on the streets to talk to passes by about the perils of TTIP and get signatures on the Europe-wide petition.  We'll have a stall staffed from 12-4pm, and need additional hands to type up petition signatures as they get finished in a nearby cafe. There's a Public Meeting happening about TTIP on Wednesday 15th April, come along if you want to find out more before hitting the streets. http://blog.38degrees.org.uk/2015/04/08/public-meeting-what-is-ttip-and-what-do-parliamentary-candidates-think-about-it/

description: An exclusive chance for voters on Northampton South Parliamentary Constituency to find out a bit more of the candidates vying to be their next Member of Parliament.They want your vote, this is your chance to put some questions to them and see whether they are worthy of your vote.The format will be that each candidate will have four minutes to tell the audience of why they should be the next MP for Northampton South. Questions will then be taken from the floor. Organised by SJRA, this is an opportunity for not just St. James Residents' but for the wider area in Northampton South. There won't be many opportunities such as this, dont miss it!This event is kindly supported by Northampton Saints RFC and Northamptonshire Rights & Equalities Council.

This treaty has been very successful (however Isael, India and Pakistan have refused to sign). The 5 nuclear nations have refused to sit down to discuss this: Obama amoing others said that he would!The wave will start in New York (26th April) and travel westwards around the world arivving in London at 13.20 (and 13.42 GMT Penzance time) on the 27th. Please gather at 13.15 promptly.Any one with a good camera and tripod and means to upload it, would be appreciated. I will have a large banner.
title: Global Wave -goodbye to nuclear weapons

description: Loughborough residents have been participating in days of action to save the NHS. Locals encouraged local residents to sign the ‘Save our NHS’ petition to all candidates standing to be an MP in Loughborough..The petition asks each MP candidate to commit to protecting the NHS from privatisation, make sure it has the funding it needs, and keep the NHS out of the TTIP trade deal with the US. Now it's time to deliver our petitions to Loughborough candidates. Why not come and join us for this 30 minute event and show your love for the NHS. Meet us outside the Town Hall (opposite the Sock Man in the town centre). There are several main car parks suitable for use if you would like to attend this event. The closest is the Sital House car park, adjacent to the Town Hall, where there are also a number of disabled parking bays. There is also The Beehive Lane multi-storey car park located on Woodgate, or the Granby Street car park.

location_text: St Peter’s Baptist Church, Eden Close, Worcester WR5 3TZ
description: Worcester Trades Union Council has invited a panel of Prospective Parliamentary Candidates for the Worcester Constituency to two free events modelled on the BBC Question Time programme.  The first QT will be on NHS and Education and will take place on Thursday, 23rd April 2015 at 7.30pm at Sixth Form College, Spetchley Road, Worcester. Doors open at 7.00pm The second QT will be on Work Pay and Jobs and will take place on Wednesday, 29th April 2015 at 7.30 p.m. at St Peter’s Baptist Church, Eden Close, Worcester. Doors open at 7.00pm Both venues have car parking, seating and good facilities. The QT’s will be open to the public but admission will be by ticket only. The events will be advertised and the tickets will be allocated on the basis of first-come-first-served. We will send copies of posters and flyers to trades council delegates next week with a request that they be widely circulated. Printed copies will also be supplied. Five tickets per event are available for branches through trades council delegates. Please will delegates contact the secretary to arrange for this supply. In addition the public are invited to apply for free tickets either by e-mailing wtuc@btinternet.com, TEXT to 0751 981 7960 or writing to WTUC c\o Unison Office.  Successful applicants for tickets will be invited to submit questions in advance of the QT. Our panel will select questions to be put to the PPCs.  This is an excellent opportunity for the trades union movement to gain good publicity and provide a service to members and the public. Please do all that you can to publicise the events. As each event will have politically interested people attending, this is a great chance to have leaflets and material available about current campaigns. One thing which really will help is for branches to have their banners available so that trade unions can make a visual impact too.
title: Hustings

location_text: In the Pedestrian Precinct of Arbroath High Street
description: Following on from our involvement in the 38 Degrees street stall/leafleting/petitioning in Montrose on 28th March, members of Radical Independence (Angus) decided to take the initiative with a street stall and open air open public meeting against TTIP from 12 noon on Saturday 18th April at ARBROATH High Street pedestrian precinct. The UNITE union are also backing this action in Arbroath, and we are expecting other groups to also become involved. The protest in Arbroath is part of a Global Day of Action, with simultaneous protests happening in Hawaii, Australia, Japan, Mexico, The Phillipines, Ecuador, Pakistan, Reunion Island (Indian Ocean), Spain, Canada, the U.S.A., Norway, Finland, Austria, Sweden, Denmark, Poland, Greece, Ireland, Romania, Hungary, Austria, Croatia, Germany, France, Italy, Belgium, Slovenia, the Netherlands, Switzerland, the Czech Republic, and, of course, Wales, and England. (Oh, okay, so the protest in Hawaii may not be timed for EXACTLY the same time as the one in Arbroath, but ye ken whit we mean.)The Transatlantic Trade and Investment Programme may have a cosy-sounding name, but in reality it's bad news for everybody except big corporations. TTIP poses a fundamental threat to our NHS, our public services, our health and safety protections and, through decisions made in secret international courts, to our democracy itself. Officials in Brussels have said that our NHS is protected from TTIP - but leaked documents show that’s not true. TTIP would allow corporations to sue us for our democratically taken decisions. Anybody concerned about this is invited to take part in the event in Arbroath, to bring banners, home made posters, etc etc, and, indeed, to speak up in public and make their voices heard.
title: Street stall/leafleting/petitioning and open air open public meeting against TTIP

location_text: 2 Marylebone Rd, offices of Which? consumer organisation, close to Great Portland St tube, also Regents Park tube
description: This is a notice for an action outside the offices of Which?, the UK consumer organisation , on Friday lunchtime April 17th 12.30-2pm. It is about Which? support for TTIP, which means the organisation is allowing itself to be used by the promoters of TTIP to say that 'consumers' support TTIP, when in fact TTIP will be devastating for consumers. Changing that position of support to one or opposition would undermine TTIP.  Why target 'WHICH?’ the UK consumer organisation? •	Because 'Which?' is still supporting TTIP (the US/EU Transatlantic Trade and Investment Partnership) despite the agreement's clear, overall negative impact on consumers.•	So supporting an agreement with high risks to consumer health and safety, including in relation to chemicals and food, and to financial service regulation, for some possible lower prices – if companies pass savings on to consumers.•	'Which?', in its organisational practice, does not make consumer assessments purely on lowest prices. Why do so with TTIP?•	The position of UK 'Which?' is a main factor holding back the EU umbrella consumer organisation, BEUC, from opposing TTIP. •	This position allows pro-TTIP forces, like the EC Commission and the UK business department (BIS) to assert that TTIP is supported by consumers - a useful tool for them when there are few tools available to promote the agreement.•	'Which?' does NOT represent all consumers, in fact their subscription base is likely to be demographically quite narrow. However, it suits both pro TTIP forces and 'Which?' to be presented as being broadly representative of consumers.  •	The campaigning that 'Which?' does on issues that affect people more broadly are contradicted by its  support for a deregulatory agreement that will boost corporations' rights and reduce states' abilities to control corporations.
title: Action outside the offices of 'which consumer organisation about its support for TTIP

location_text: Which HQ, 2 Marylebone rd London NW14Df
description: Protest organised by StopTTIP uk, NoTTIP, Occupy and People Before Profit.Lobbying the head honchos of Which (UK Consumer organisation) to ask why they are supporting and advocating for TTIP. And thus giving pro TTIP groups the opportunity to falsely claim that 'consumers' are in favour of TTIP and stand to benefit from it. We ask Which why they are judging TTIP purely on the idea it will reduce prices of some goods, yet usually they are as concerned about quality, not just price. We say TTIP is a 'Don't Buy' not a 'Best Buy'! It risks bringing in GMO and foodstuffs adulterated with chemicals from the USA.
title: TTIP: Which? side are you on?

description: Some of us are joining in the International day of action against the Tafta and Ttip agreements this coming Saturday from 11 am to 13 am.  We have got some leaflets from a previous action day to had out too. You can read all about it on this website: https://www.globaltradeday.org/. PEOPLE AND THE PLANET BEFORE PROFITS ! Global Call to Action to Defeat Free Trade and Investment TreatiesWe, civil society organizations, trade unions, farmers, youth, women, indigenous movements and grassroots activists from across the world, are calling for a Global Day of Action on 18 April 2015 to stop free trade and investment deals and promote an economy that works for people and the planet. For the last decades, secret trade and investment agreements have been pushed by corporations and governments, damaging our rights and the environment. For the last decades, we have been fighting for food sovereignty, for the commons, to defend our jobs, our lands, internet freedom and to reclaim democracy. Along the way, we have grown as a movement, we have made our voices heard and we had victories. Together, we can stop the agreements that are being negotiated and reverse the negative impacts of past agreements. We can drive forward our alternatives based on human rights over corporate privileges. We call on organizations, individuals and alliances to participate by organizing decentralized actions across the five continents. We welcome a diversity of tactics and solidarity actions from across the world that will help raise awareness, engage and mobilize people locally towards a new trade and economic model that works for people and the planet.
title: International Day of Action against Tafta/Ttip agreements

description: We'll meet up first for a local Hove planning meeting, lots to think about in these final weeks. Then go over to the last scheduled debates for the 3 main Hove candidates. There's an option to submit questions in advance for the debate. Details from their website below:  "Of the many challenges that the city faces in the years to come, affordable housing and energy costs, in particular heating, rank high. This year our forum will explore some potential solutions. Three Parliamentary Candidates for Hove, Graham Cox, Peter Kyle and Chris Hawtree will put forward some of their solutions and engage in a debate with Andrew Winter, Chief Executive of Brighton Housing Trust and Kayla Ente, Chief Executive of Brighton and Hove Energy Services, who will present their views about the needs for affordable housing and heat, as well as outlining some possibilities drawn from experiences in other cities. Members of the public are invited to submit question in advance of the meeting, by email to info@hovecivicsociety.org. Questions will also be taken during the meeting. Admission is free to Civic Society members, or £3 on the door for non-members. The meeting will be held at The Courtlands Hotel and starts at 7.30pm."
title: Quick catch up at the Sussex Cricketer Pub, then onto The Civic Society Debate

location_text: Saint Augustines Church 27 Brocco Bank Sheffield, South York, S11 8RS
description: 38 Degrees members are getting together to talk about how we can get involved in the general election in the Sheffield Hallam constituency. People from other parts of Sheffield are more than welcome to attend if you want to, as many of the activities will take place in the city centre.

Let's make this one massive and highly visible in the run-in to the General Election in May... we can fit another one too before the date, or even on the date!! Let's turn up in droves and let the Government know that they can't have our NHS. I'm thinking that we should deliver the petition after the demonstration at 12pm. Maybe we could walk through the streets with our banners, collecting more signatures, or we could meet separately in the Art Cafe which is just off Bonn Square between the church and the Co-op Bank and deliver the petition from there. I'm for the former... either way, here is our event!
title: Demonstration / Petition Delivery

On Saturday 28 February, members gathered at Finchley Rd and collected 1,000 signatures as part of the 'Save our NHS' day of action.  On Saturday we saw what can be achieved when we come together locally, this meeting will be about discussing how else we can collaborate at a local level in the lead up to the general election.   If you're able to come, please click 'yes I'll attend' so we have an idea of numbers.

location_text: Outside Starbucks Coffee, High Street, Winchester, Hants. Uunited Kingdom
description: Our last push before the General Election 7th May 2015. 'Our NHS is very precious, we all need and rely on the NHS in the best and worst times in our life, ourselves and our loved ones.  We want to protect it for our future and our children's future. 'People of Winchester have had enough of ongoing destruction of the NHS and we demand that their candidates will save the NHS by stopping any privatisation and stopping the TTIP/ ISDS, which is being done by 'Stealth'.  The politicians and our MP'S have the POWER to Stop the privitisation and selling of the TTIP. We the PEOPLE have the POWER TO STOP and get them to commit to saving and protecting the funding for and the NHS. We have to SAVE & DEFEND our beloved NHS. For our Communities and for the next Generation. So let's get there and do this. * Saving Our NHS* No To Cuts, No To Privatisation, No To Sell  Off to EU-US Trade Deal TTIP (TPP, ISDS, NAFTA)* Protect it from US Health Corporations, this power would be increased by ISDS, mechanism of TTIP* Cracking down on Taxdodging (Starbucks, Boots, Parliamentary & The 1%)* Make sure NHS has the funding it needs to provide High Quality Health Care* Patients NOT Customers, Public Service NOT Private Service
title: NHS Day of Action

description: On Wednesday, there’s another event for the NHS in Kingswood, being organised by the local Re-formed Save Cossham Hospital group. The group are holding a rally at Kingswood Park at 9.30am, calling for a Minor Injuries Unit at Cossham Hospital - that’s run by the NHS, not for profit. Are you interested in going along? The Save Cossham Hospital group hope that by calling for NHS-run services at Cossham Hospital now, they’ll show politicians standing to be the MP in Kingswood that local people want an NHS that focuses on saving lives, not making money for private companies.

description: To celebrate International Women’s Week.Going Through the Change!Film & Discussion with director Anne-Marie SweeneyTuesday 10th March, 7.30pm Coleford Library GL16 8RHThe 1984/5 Miners’ strike changed their lives and for the feisty Women Against Pit Closures there was “No Going Back!” Joined by stars from picket lines, peace camps and war zones, Going Through the Change, commissioned by National Women Against Pit Closures, features some of the most experienced frontline voices of the past 30 years.“Inspiring! STRONG WOMEN all over the place, wonderful women! We need each other!”PEGGY SEEGER – Folk Queen.“It brilliantly shows a sassy, fearless movement”MORNING STAR.“This is no piece of nostalgia - it will have relevance to all those fighting injustice for years to come” BRENDA PROCTER National Chair Women Against Pit Closures.Anne-Marie Sweeney is an acclaimed filmmaker. Comments on her other films include:“Watch this superb video, it will make you laugh, perhaps cry and above all angry!” JOHN PILGER.“A marvellous film revealing the leadership of women – it should give us all hope.” TONY BENNEntry by donation- A Coleford Festival of Words Eventwww.thecolefordhub.info*(this film is not representative of the views of the County Council, or the Library Service)
